title: Reflections on 6 years as a founder at Wren
content:
Friday marked my last day working on my first startup, Wren. I created the company in 2019 with my co-founders Mimi Tran Zambetti (now my fiancée), and Landon Brand. Over the years, we built a category-defining and category-leading marketplace, raised venture capital from prestigious investors like Y Combinator and Union Square Ventures, hired employees, let employees go, acquired competitors, got (partially) acquired ourselves, nearly ran out of money, eventually turned it around and reached profitability, and much more in-between. Landon and Mimi will continue running and growing Wren.

I will do my best to chronicle my learnings, and perhaps more helpfully my failings and shortcomings, across six years building a startup straight out of college. Frankly, I am doing this more for myself than you (or anyone who happens to read this), so I apologize for anything lacking context. If you have questions, please find me online.
